artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Akiyama Buemon; Carver: Noguchi Enkatsu
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 478.14; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 236, p. 278.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; standing woman seen from back with head turned in profile to PR, wearing white blouse and red-orange skirt, with very long hair tied with yellow cord; flying demon with grey wings, grey hat, grey beard and hair and blue lips in URC, wearing grey flowered garment; some flying autumn leaves; ring of moon, ULC
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年之印 {Yoshitoshi no in} | Carver’s seal: 円治刀 {Enkatsu tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From One Hundred Aspects of the Moon (Tsuki hyakushi 月百姿)
title: Midnight Moon at Mount Yoshino: Iga no tsubone
